info.title: *IBM INTERNAL USE ONLY* IBM Business Automation Workflow Artifact Management REST Interface
info.description: *** IBM INTERNAL USE ONLY. *** IBM Business Automation Workflow REST resources for managing artifacts in Business Automation Workflow.

post.summary: Obtain a CSRF prevention token.
post.description: Obtains a CSRF prevention token and, optionally, refreshes the user's group membership information.

parameters.name: login_request
parameters.description: A parameter used to specify login information.

201.description: The request was processed successfully and returned a new cross-site request forgery (CSRF) token.

400.description: Invalid input.

post.summary: Import migration data into a 2202+ system.
post.description: This API imports the BAS migration data after you upgrade to 22.0.2. The directory path must be set to the directory specified in the '/migratecp4ba/export' API that contains the exported migration data set. This API is an asynchronous operation. See the import.log file in the migration directory for the API's status. You must be logged in as an Administrator to start this API.

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: The config information includes the directory path that contains the migration data to import. Use double forward slashes for the directory path.

204.description: Migration started.  See the import.log file in the migration directory for status.

400.description: Invalid input.

403.description: The caller is not authorized to perform the request.

post.summary: Export migration data from a pre-2202 system.
post.description: This API exports the BAS migration data and stores it in a directory before you upgrade to the new version. This data will need to be imported by using the 'migratecp4ba/import' API call after you complete the upgrade. Make sure to save all unsaved changes before executing this API. Failure to migrate the data can result in losing your BAS data. This API is asynchronous. See the export.log file in the migration directory for the API's status. You must be logged in as an Administrator to start this API.

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: The config information includes the directory path, which stores the exported migration data. Use double forward slashes for the directory path.

204.description: Migration started. See the export.log file in the migration directory for status.

400.description: Invalid input.

403.description: The caller is not authorized to perform the request.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of projects.
get.description: Retrieves a list of all projects from Workflow Center.

parameters.name: BPMCSRFToken
parameters.description: Indicates the cross-site request forgery prevention token for Artifact Management REST APIs.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Lists the values used to filter the results. The default query with no filters specified returns all projects. Valid values are: 'favorite', 'archived', 'not_archived', 'template', 'not_template', 'toolkit', 'not_toolkit', 'workflow', 'app', 'solution', 'automation_srvc'.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Determines how to sort the results. The string is specified as fieldName(asc|desc), where fieldName can be name, acronym, date, recently_opened, or recently_updated.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Searches for a container that has the specified text in the name, description, or acronym fields.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Specifies the position of the first container in a list of entries to return from the query result set.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of containers to return.

400.description: The request contains invalid or missing parameters.

403.description: The caller is not authorized to perform the request.

404.description: The requested resource does not exist.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of snapshots.
get.description: Retrieves a list of snapshots for a specific project.

parameters.name: BPMCSRFToken
parameters.description: Indicates the cross-site request forgery prevention token for Artifact Management REST APIs.

parameters.name: container
parameters.description: The acronym of the project.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Lists the values to be used to filter the results. The default query has no filters specified and, therefore, returns all snapshots. Valid values are: 'archived', 'installed'.

parameters.name: optional_parts
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of optional parts to be returned in the response object. The selections where_used and shared_toolkit_usage can be used only when you request toolkit snapshots. Valid values are: 'where_used', 'dependencies', 'shared_toolkit_usage', 'possible_actions'.
parameters.x-display-name: Optional parts to be returned in the response object.

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: If the project has multiple tracks, you can specify the track acronym to view only those snapshots that belong to the track. If a track is not specified, all the snapshots from the default track are returned.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Determines how to sort the results. The string is specified as fieldName(asc|desc), where fieldName can be name, acronym, or date.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Searches for a snapshot with the specified text in the name, description, or acronym fields.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: In a list of entries, the offset specifies the position of the first snapshot to return from the query result set.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Maximum number of snapshots to return.

400.description: The request contains invalid or missing parameters.

403.description: The caller is not authorized to perform the request.

404.description: The requested resource does not exist.

login_request.title: Login Request
login_request.description: Requests an object to create a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) token.

refresh_groups.description: Indicates with a flag whether the current user's group membership is refreshed in the Business Automation Workflow database.

requested_lifetime.description: Requested token lifetime in seconds (positive integer). This value must be less than the maximum lifetime: 7200.

csrf_token.title: CSRF protection token
csrf_token.description: The token Artifact Management REST APIs require to prevent cross-site request forgery attacks.

exception.description: An exception object that describes the details of the REST API error.

error_number.description: The message ID of the exception.

error_message.description: The message text of the exception.

items.description: An array of parameter strings inserted into the error message.

error_message_parameters.description: Message text parameters for the exception.

failure.description: The data structure for reporting the results of bulk actions that were not successful.

id.description: The ID of the object related to the failed invoked action.

failure_reason.description: The reason for the REST API replay error.

error_reason.description: The message ID of the replay error.

error_description.description: The message text of the replay error.

containers.description: The result of a query for projects.

type.description: Indicates whether the project is a workflow, solution, app, general, or automation_srvc. Workflow projects are process apps or toolkits. Solution projects are case solutions or case solution templates. App projects are Business Automation Studio apps or app templates.

default_branch.description: The acronym of the default branch of the project.

default_branch_id.description: The ID of the default branch of the project.

application_flow_id.description: The ID of the flow artifact of an app project.

application_flow_description.description: The description of the flow artifact of an app project.

application_flow_icon_id.description: The ID of the icon that represents the app project.

rich_description.description: The description of the project format tags.

creation_date.description: The date when the project was created.

creator_user_id.description: The ID of the user who created the project.

creator_user_name.description: The user name of the user who created the project.

last_modified_date.description: The date when the project was last modified.

last_modified_user_id.description: The ID of the user who last modified the project.

last_modified_user_name.description: The user name of the user who last modified the project.

toolkit.description: Indicates whether the project is a toolkit.

template.description: Indicates whether the project is a template.

archived.description: Indicates whether the project is archived.

favorite.description: Indicates whether the project is a favorite.

regular_app.description: Indicates whether the project is a regular app.

designer_extension.description: Indicates whether the project is a designer extension.

shared.description: Indicates whether the project is shared.

shared_by_user_name.description: The user name of the user who shared the project.

shared_by_date.description: The date when the project was shared.

is_by_subscription.description: Indicates whether the project is subscribed to from another Workflow Center server.

subscription_compatible.description: Indicates whether the subscription is compatible with this Workflow Center server.

branches_enabled.description: Indicates whether the project supports branches.

has_multiple_branches.description: Indicates whether the project has multiple branches.

immutable.description: Indicates whether the project is immutable.

system.description: Indicates whether the project is a system project.

system_data.description: Indicates whether the project is the system data toolkit (TWSYS).

process_portal.description: Indicates whether the project is the Process Portal app.

can_delete.description: Indicates whether the project can be deleted.

can_delete_ignore_state.description: Indicates whether the project can be deleted regardless of its archived status.

hidden.description: Indicates whether the project is hidden and should be displayed in the user interface.

gov_project.description: Indicates whether the project is a governance project.

used_as_gov.description: Indicates whether the project is used as a governance project.

duplicate_shortname.description: Indicates that the short name is duplicated.

base_container_acronym.description: Indicates the acronym of the base template or project that this project or template is based on.

base_version_acronym.description: Indicates the acronym of the snapshot of the base template or project.

is_template_update.description: Indicates whether the app's base template has a new snapshot.

solution_prefix.description: If a case solution, the case prefix.

permissions.description: The permissions that the current user has to access and work with the project. Valid values are: 'list', 'create', 'read', 'update', 'delete', 'write', 'administration'.

most_recent_system_comment.description: Most recently published and publish requests.

is_icon_set.description: Indicates whether a project icon is set

previous.description: A URL that returns the previous page of the results.

next.description: A URL that returns the next page of the results.

offset.description: The offset into the total list of artifacts.

total_size.description: The total number of artifacts in the list.

size.description: The number of artifacts in the returned list.

has_more.description: Indicates whether there are more artifacts than what was included in the returned list.

subscription.description: Detailed information about the toolkit subscription.

shared_by_user_id.description: The ID of the user who is sharing the toolkit.

workflow_center_name.description: The name of the Workflow Center that this toolkit is being shared from.

new_container.title: Container Post Parameters
new_container.description: The body parameters for creating a project.

container_acronym.description: The acronym of the new project. Note that for workflow projects the acronym can't start with a number or include special characters, spaces, or JavaScript-reserved words; the acronym must be less than or equal to seven characters; the acronym must be unique. For case solution projects, the acronym must be between two and five English alphanumeric characters and must start with an English alphabetic character; the acronym for a case solution doesn't need to be unique.
